content: the apiary puff by valerie lawson 2011 materials approx 24 yds fingering weight/sock yarn per puff *worsted weight cotton yarn can also be used be sure to adjust hook size accordingly size f 3 75mm crochet hook stitch markers tapestry needle for weaving in ends fiberfill/scrap yarn/ stuffing of your choice this crocheted puff is done in rounds do not join rounds or turn your work move your stitch markers up as you go this makes it easy to keep track of your rounds gauge 7sc and 9 row = 1 the completed puff measures approx 3 across at the widest point does not apply to the worsted weight puff special stitches decrease insert hook yo and draw up a loop insert hook into next stitch yo and draw up a loop yo and draw through all 3 loops chain 12 round 1 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and each chain across continue single_crochet around the bottom of the chain 22 single_crochet round 2 single_crochet in next stitch place stitch marker this marks the start of the round 2sc in next stitch single_crochet in next 8 2 single_crochet in next stitch single_crochet in next stitch and place your second marker 2 single_crochet in next stitch single_crochet in next 8 2 single_crochet in last stitch before the marker 26 single_crochet round 3 single_crochet around to beginning marker 26 single_crochet this pattern was inspired by the beekeeper s quilt by stephanie dosen feel free to use this pattern for non-commercial use friends family swaps round 4 single_crochet in marked stitch 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet across 2 single_crochet in last stitch before marker single_crochet in marked stitch 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet across 2 single_crochet in last stitch before marker 30 single_crochet rnds 5-10 repeat row 3 and 4 you will be increasing 4 stitches on every other round round 11 single_crochet around 42 single_crochet begin decrease rounds round 12 single_crochet in marked stitch decrease single_crochet across to last 2 before marker decrease single_crochet in marked stitch decrease single_crochet across to last 2 before marker decrease 38 single_crochet round 13 single_crochet around rnds 14-20 repeat row 11 and 12 decreasing 4 stitches on every other round fasten_off leaving a long enough tail for sewing the top together stuff your puff make it as flat or fluffy as you want slip_stitch or sew the top of the puff together take care to leave the top flat and even with the bottom in order to keep the shape consistent weave in ends enjoy the squishy puffy goodness puff project ideas once you ve accumulated enough puffs you can put them together in various ways make blankets lap blankets dining chair cushions bathmats kitchen mats etc single puffs can be used for make-up removers / facial scrubbies or even cat toys you are limited only by your imagination you can use various ways to join the puffs single_crochet them together mattress stitch or even just use scrap yarn and tie them together at
